posts.post:
I’m going to bed now
I can’t imagine myself alive next year. Should I just give up on school and everything else right now because I know I’m going to die anyways. Not sure what I should do
posts.Post Summary: One prominent self-state in this post is characterized by thoughts of self-harm and hopelessness, along with evident avoidance through sleep.

A.highlighted_evidence: Should I just give up on school and everything else right now because I know I’m going to die anyways

D.Category: (6) Expectation that competence needs will not be met

posts.post:
what I wish I could say to my parents
I’m not lazy. I have depression and anxiety and doctors literally told you the other day. Everything is hard for me right now. Even the things you’re supposed do daily takes too much energy to do. I hope you can stop prioritizing school but me instead for a little while so I can heal. My thoughts are not silly or a teenage phase either and taking antidepressants won’t cure everything immediately. I know you guys keep telling me other people have it worse than me but I can’t help feeling like this. You made me promise you that I would go to school tomorrow but I honestly don’t think I can. I’m too scared to and thought of it makes me want to die. So please shut up about school just for a little while, please. I’m sorry for being such a disappoint.
posts.Post Summary: Two self-states are recognized. One is very subtle, almost nonexistent, and is tied to his suffering, where he comes to an acceptance of it, realizing it is not trivial. The dominant self-state is marked by a depressed affect, with his parents perceived as unattuned to his needs by making him to go to school, which he finds unbearable. He expresses fear, which intensifies his desire to die, and has a negative self-cognition, viewing himself as a disappointment.

C-S.highlighted_evidence: My thoughts are not silly or a teenage phase

A.highlighted_evidence: Everything is hard for me right now

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I’m sorry for being such a disappoint.

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: I hope you can stop prioritizing school but me instead for a little while so I can heal

D.Category: (6) Expectation that competence needs will not be met
D.highlighted_evidence: I’m too scared to and thought of it makes me want to die

Thanks 4 telling me I won’t try to die anymor

posts.post:
People who don’t have anyone to eat lunch at school with where do you go?
I don’t have anyone to eat with so I just go home but I’m tired of having to walk home everyday since our lunch break is only 40mins and it takes around 7mins to walk home and back. Any ideas where else I could eat lunch

B-S.highlighted_evidence: People who don’t have anyone to eat lunch at school with where do you go

posts.post:
felt like the psychiatrist was judging me because I told her I’ve tried to commit suicide 2 times
She asked me a series of questions and then asked how many times have I tried to commit suicide and I said two. She repeated back “two?” and I said yeah. The tone she said it in sounded like “pft only twice that’s so less” if you know what I mean. I could be remembering it wrong but I’ve been thinking about it since the meeting. Is being suicidal for 2 years and only attempting it twice weird?
posts.Post Summary:
The dominant self-state reflects the writer's perception of the psychiatrist as judgmental regarding her suicide attempts. She feels the psychiatrist is detached and also engages in self-criticism about her thoughts and attempts, questioning if the attempts are insufficient.

A faint subtext can be heard, where there seems to be a desire for validation about her situation—perhaps because it feels unusual that she has a chance to improve and that not everything is hopeless.

C-S.highlighted_evidence: I’ve been thinking about it since the meeting. Is being suicidal for 2 years and only attempting it twice weird?

C-O.Category: (2) Perception of the other as detached or over attached
C-O.highlighted_evidence: felt like the psychiatrist was judging me because I told her I’ve tried to commit suicide 2 times

posts.post: where’s the rest of the gang

timeline_summary:
The dominant self-state is marked by an anxious and depressed affect, accompanied by avoidance and self-harm behaviors, with a perception of others as detached and not understanding her.

The adaptive self-state is a faint attempt to be attuned to her own needs, though it is close to engaging in avoidance behaviors as a way to temporarily feel better.
